text:
The pt is an 80 yo man with multiple medical problems including
   prostate ca with mets to the spine. He recently was admitted for a
   ventral hernia repair and was eventually discharged to HRC. On [**9-28**]
   the pt presented from rehab with fevers, hypotension, and an altered
   mental status all c/w sepsis due to MRSA bacteremia.  His course in the
   MICU has been complicated by persistent fevers, serial positive blood
   cultures and hypoxemia as well as an impaired mental status.  The pt
   remains a Full Code. Pt had  head/abd CT with both PO & IV contrast
   provided to look for possible abscess(es).  Completed acetylcysteine
   doses.
   Events:
   Pt hypotensive received total 2250 mls of NS bolus with some effect.
   Dropped her pressures again, Central line inserted . Started on
   levophed as bp dropped at 3 am.
   Hypotension (not Shock)
   Assessment:
   SBP in low 80
s, maps in 40
   Action:
   Total; 2 lits of NS bloused.
   Response:
   Sbp in 100
s, maps in mid 50
s., SBP dropped again @ MN. RIJ inserted @
   1 am. Started levophed @ 0.03 mics/kg/min.  CVP was 10.SBP > 100  .
   Plan:
   Monitor  BP, I/O,CVP.
   Hypoxemia
   Assessment:
   Spo2 maintained in high 90
s on 50 % O2.
   Action:
   Pt sat upright in bed.  Chest PT provided.  Pt encouraged to cough/deep
   breath. Oral suctioning done, obtained large to moderate amts of thick
   blood tinged secretions.
   Response:
   Pt  on 50% FiO2 venti-mask with nl sats in the high 90
   Plan:
   Cont to turn freq, sit pt upright, encourage cough/deep breathing,
   provide chest PT and provide additional NTS if all else fails.
   Impaired Skin Integrity
   Assessment:
   The pt has a documented unstageable pressure ulcer on coccyx per skin
   care RN consult performed on [**10-5**].
   Action:
     Aquacell/Softsorb dsg applied as instructed by skin care RN recs.
   Dressing change information printed from pt chart and posted on pts
   room for convenience.  Lt arm swelling present. Elevated on 2 pillows.
   Response:
   No obvious change in wound at time of dsg change.
   Plan:
   Cont to follow all skin care recs as directed by skin care RN.
   Fever, unknown origin (FUO, Hyperthermia, Pyrexia)
   Assessment:
   Pt temp up to 100.1 Prn  PO Acetaminophen q 6.
   Action:
   Started on IV ciprofloxacin, Stat IV cefepime given once at 0130 am.
   Central  line cultures sent with am labs..   Pt had  head/abd CT with
   both PO & IV contrast provided to look for possible abscess(es).  No
   change in current antibx cov at this time.
   Response:
   WBC 14.
   Plan:
   Cont to follow VS & temp curve, awaiting CT results
